challengeName: Enhance Demo App for Brivo Labs SAM API
detailedRequirements:
Task Overview

We have a very small node+express application that negotiates an OAuth2 token with the Brivo Labs SAM API.  It is meant to be run locally.  I allows developers to quickly get a token, and to see a reference application in action.

Task Requirement

This challenge is to extract this "oauth-demo" directory from the SAM code repository into a standalone application managed in its own top-level repository.  The challenge also includes several enhancments to improve usability.

1) Provide detailed code comments and a concise README file with basic install/run instructions.  The goal is to make this a publicly available demo/sample app to help get potential consumers of the API a quick way to get a token.  The audience is developers, but do not assume familiarity with node.js.

2) Consolidate these two files: app_development.coffee and app_production.coffee.  Provide only one version of the app that works for all three environments (producation, -cs, and locally).  Care should be take to supply the apikey header (using the supplied client_id) when calling the production API. also use *request* model as in app_production version instead of *passport* module as in app_development version as the former will give user more details about what is going on.

3) Move these from consolidated app_xxx.coffee files to a config file:

  • DEMO_APP_HOST (default localhost)
  • DEMO_APP_PORT (default 3003)

4) In the config file, also define an array of environments
each environment has at least: {commonName, samUrl}

  • local: http://localhost:5000
  • cs: https://brivolabs-sam-cs.herokuapp.com
  • prod: https://api.brivolabs.com


5) Update the “home” page to provide inputs as follows:
a) Environment (dropdown/select list based on environment configs, default is prod)
b) domain (small text box, default 1)
c) client id (medium text box)
d) client secret (medium text box)

6) For localhost, include also a default pair of id/secret (based on the bootstrapped values in SAM).  When ‘localhost’ is chosen from the drop-down, populate the client ID and secret accordingly.

7) The “app_authorized” page should also make an ajax call to “/me” and present the response on the page as pretty-formatted JSON.

8) Provide a button to “logout” of the demo app.  This would just remove the web session.  This is to allow you to easily log in with a different user and/or IDp.

9) Fix the “deny” action during authorization.  It seems not to work correctly.  It should remove the session and return to the home page, ideally.

10) Provide a simple bash and/or node wrapper script that starts the server, and opens the home page in your browser (possibly using: https://github.com/jjrdn/node-open)

Source Code

Provided in challenge forums.

Deliverables

  • The oauth-demo folder with all new/modified files.
  • Patch file that include cleanup of the oauth-demo from provided source code.
